body.name: Nady SP-4C Dynamic Neodymium Microphone - Professional vocal microphone for performance, stage, karaoke, public speaking, recording - includes 15' XLR-to-1/4" cable

features: Linear full-range response with crisp mid-range presence for optimal clarity and punch. A perfect all-purpose, versatile stage and recording microphone

Powerful neodymium element cuts through the loudest sound pressure level situations without compromising sound. Ultra-light aluminum voice coil & transformerless design provide noise-free, accurate reproduction across the audio spectrum

Tight cardioid polar pattern provides excellent off-axis rejection for superior gain before feedback. Advanced capsule multi-axis rubber shockmount minimizes handling noise. External on/off switch for easy control of audio from stage
Rugged, all-metal construction for maximum reliability featuring a zinc die-cast case and steel mesh windscreen with anti-dent ring
Professional grade 15 ft. XLR-to-1/4 cable supplied
body.description: Nady SP-4C Microphone The Nady SP-4C is a handheld cardioid dynamic microphone offering a cost-effective solution for reproduction of vocals and speech in public address and live stage applications. Its dynamic element utilizes a neodymium magnet for high output without excessive preamp gain and delivers a frequency response of 50 Hz to 12 kHz. Low noise and distortion are achieved through the incorporation of a humbucking voice coil and the transformerless design. The internal multi-axis rubber shockmount isolates the mic element from the body, reducing noise from microphone handling. An on/off switch is provided for convenient muting of the mic between speeches or performances. The SP-4C features durable, all-metal construction and includes a 15' XLR to 1/4" cable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good Product, Excellent Support
reviews.reviewText: I received the product from Audiosavings promptly and before the date promised. I'm not very experienced with sound recording, but this Nady mic performs very well (and as good as I'd hoped); and the price is excellent. It is soundly constructed with a quality cable. Acoustics seem very good. The on/off switch is very useful (I'd hate to have to do without it).The mic arrived with a 15 foot cable instead of the 20 foot cable advertised. I needed the longer cable for my setup. I contacted Audiosavings right away, and they responded immediately, offering to work with me to supply the advertised 20 foot cable with my returning the 15 foot cable. I then proposed an alternative to make the mic/cable work for me via my mixer--a male XLR to male 1/4-inch adapter. It would give me more flexibility than the original order. They agreed and sent me not only an adapter but a 10 foot adapter cable ($19.95 value at their web site),and they footed the expense for both the adapter cable and shipping. All with prompt service and without argument. So I'm singing their praises.The combination of a really good mic and excellent customer service warrants the five-stars. I'll deal with these guys any time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2009
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent in a pinch for amateur singers
reviews.reviewText: I originally purchased this for my daughter for use as a second mic for her Karaoke machine. Since then I have borrowed it for a back up vocalist in a band I have recently joined. Today I am online to purchase two more to replace the "professional" mic's supplied by another band member for the rest of the vocalists. The other mics are nothing but feedback generators, and sound far too thin compared to this Nady. This mic is not quite as responsive as my Shure SM58, but it's close enough for live music, and the price just can't be beat. This mic is nice and hefty, and the quality of materials used in construction is very apparent. Frankly, I don't understand how anybody can really be profiting from building and shipping them for this price. So far I haven't had any issues with the supplied cable, but if the professional in you can't tolerate the thought of singing through a 1/4" jack, you can use it with an XLR cable purchased separately. My only complaint is that it has a cheesy label wrapped around it just beneath the screen that absolutely screams "karaoke mic". To summarize: If you can't afford a $100 mic, skip everything between, and go straight for this one at ten bucks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good quality microphone was just saying that I paid for something that was returned.
reviews.reviewText: I just received the package today which was very well packaged. but the reason why I gave only four star is because I can tell this was a return item. The box is ripped partially open the microphone wasn't even placed correctly in the plastic molding that would comfortably support the microphone for shipping. The twist tie that was holding the bundle of excessive wire wasn't professionally wrapped from Factory correctly. All indications showing that this was a return product so it was not brand new out of the box. I asked you pay for something that's brand new. So I was a little nervous at first because my thoughts were why was his return this must be defective broken until I plugged it into my amplifier to test it out. And it must have been my lucky day because the microphone and it up working perfect. The on and off switch works the cable disconnect from the mic ok and I unscrewed the top of the microphone to make sure the condenser mic was not damaged by the previous people that returned it and that seems to be intact and was not damaged. So I couldn't find anything wrong with this microphone so I'm deciding to keep it but unfortunately I'm leaving the four star because I did pay for a brand new out of the box microphone and I did not receive that. Shame on the vendor for releasing such merchandise to a consumer that is paying for something that is brand new. There should have been a small discount off on something that was actually return. But I am willing to let this go for now but I would like to make it known here to Amazon and to the public. As far as the microphone it feels like a very nice quality microphone it has good weight the frequency response according to the manual is not bad and it works very well with my amplifier. Very quiet stable microphone and seems to be a good manufactured product since I've never purchase from this vendor before. I would like to say I would recommend this vendor but like I said above I did receive a used product but I do recommend the microphone

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Mic for the Money
reviews.reviewText: I run a Karaoke DJ service and my Mic's are constantly being abused by patrons who have had a little to much liquid encouragement. The included Mic cable is decent but not what I use. The Mic it's self has clean crisp sound and it has been dropped numerous times and still sounds clear and works well. I would not recommend this for actual live band use except for instrument pick ups would be fine. With that being said it does work great and is very sturdy for the Karaoke abuse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my karaoke machine about 7 months ago and am just getting around to review. They both worked fine, for about 4 months. Not sure what exactly happened, but come 4th of July, I have a karaoke party, and 1 of the mics just doesn't work anymore. I pulled it apart, put it back together - no go. Kind of a bummer when you've got 20 people in your house ready to karaoke.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beats the pants off mics that cost $100+
reviews.reviewText: A little over half a year ago I decided I wanted to start a podcast. Looking into equipment I grabbed a decent $40 mixer, some 1/4 mono to 1/8 stero converter cables, an MXL 990 with shock mount, two XLR cables, and this NADY mic as a guest mic. I tried over and over to tune the MXL in correctly and could never get it to sound right. I noticed, however, that my guests sounded awesome on the cheaper NADY SP-4C. After I went to having guests dial in through Skype I started using the NADY SP-4C as my main mic and its astounding the quality you get out of it. Remember DO NOT use the included XLR to 1/4 cable, it sounds horrible with that. Instead lay down the $6 or so bucks on the XLR cable you can easily get through Amazon and you'll have an excellent mic.If you want to listen to the quality yourself check out my podcast. Just search for Holy Shatt on iTunes or go to Raleighite.com

Lo compre en no mas de $200 pesos, en realidad no esperaba mucho pero la verdad salio muy bueno por el precio, cuando lo conecto tiene pequeñas interferencias tiene juego en el plug no le hecho la culpa al micrófono podría ser mi cable aun así me es muy útil para prestarle a los niños y no hay problema que se les caiga, esta opción la utilice ya que tengo unos shure y la verdad no los cuidan así que esta opción me vino genial.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cheap price for a seriously good mic. I mean
reviews.reviewText: Cheap price for a seriously good mic.I mean, it's not the "best" mic out there, but the built quality is there as well the sound quality... good enough for doing news podcast/video recording on the internet! I already recommended it to some of my friends and if I need another mic, I'll buy it again without thinking twice!

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price, you can't ask for a lot, but none the less it delivers
reviews.reviewText: Bought it, and overall it sounds pretty good for the price. There are lots of cheap microphones out there today, and a good dynamic normally costs about $100, so going this low in price isn't really suggested. That said, it still holds up pretty well comparatively.The non-balanced cable it came with was prone to a lot of noise. I replaced it with quality balanced cable that cost as much as the microphone itself, but it got the noise level down.It is prone to handling noise, but I get the same level of noise when handling my SM57. It also isn't able to handle plosives (pops) all that well, but this isn't an issue if using proper microphone technique.Like most dynamic mics, this requires a lot of gain to use, so if you don't have a decent mic preamp, you're either going to have low volume or lots of noise. Just something to be aware of.The tone of the microphone isn't really appealing to me, but I'm use to using $400 dynamic microphones. It will pass the grade for most people easily.Overall, I bought this for someone starting out with recording live interviews in public spaces. It's a good price, but I tend to think if you're going to do something, it's better to spend a bit more money and do it right. Still, a solid buy for most people, and it definitely offers good value for something like karaoke.
This product offers the best value for your money. The voice quality is crisp and clear. Use it for bingo activity at our seniors home. Works great thus far!

Super impressed with this microphone. It's better than the one that came with my karaoke machine, and having a good friend who LOVES karaoke and has been encouraging me to start singing again, the quality of the microphone is a big deal! I plan to order a second one and keep the original microphone that came with my machine as a backup, there's no point in having a crap microphone when I could have two of these nice ones. Very impressed, especially at this price point...
